de.undercouch.actson

Class JsonParser

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.undercouch.actson.JsonParser

  • public class JsonParser
extends java.lang.Object

    A non-blocking, event-based JSON parser.

    The parser gets input data from a feeder that can be accessed through getFeeder(). See JsonFeeder for more details.

    Since:
    1.0.0

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      JsonParser()
      Constructs a JSON parser that uses the UTF-8 charset to decode input data
      JsonParser(java.nio.charset.Charset charset)
      Constructs a JSON parser
      JsonParser(JsonFeeder feeder)
      Constructs the JSON parser

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      double getCurrentDouble()
      If the event returned by nextEvent() was JsonEvent.VALUE_DOUBLE this method will return the parsed double
      int getCurrentInt()
      If the event returned by nextEvent() was JsonEvent.VALUE_INT this method will return the parsed integer
      java.lang.String getCurrentString()
      If the event returned by nextEvent() was JsonEvent.VALUE_STRING this method will return the parsed string
      JsonFeeder getFeeder()
      Get the feeder that can be used to provide more input to the parser
      int getMaxDepth() 
      int nextEvent()
      Call this method to proceed parsing the JSON text and to get the next event.
      void setMaxDepth(int depth)
      Set the maximum number of modes on the stack (basically the maximum number of nested objects/arrays in the JSON text to parse)

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • JsonParser

        Constructs a JSON parser that uses the UTF-8 charset to decode input data

      • JsonParser

        public JsonParser(java.nio.charset.Charset charset)
        Constructs a JSON parser
        Parameters:
        charset - the charset that should be used to decode the parser's input data

      • JsonParser

        public JsonParser(JsonFeeder feeder)
        Constructs the JSON parser
        Parameters:
        feeder - the feeder that will provide the parser with input data

    • Method Detail

      • setMaxDepth

        public void setMaxDepth(int depth)
        Set the maximum number of modes on the stack (basically the maximum number of nested objects/arrays in the JSON text to parse)
        Parameters:
        depth - the maximum number of modes

      • getMaxDepth

        public int getMaxDepth()
        Returns:
        the maximum number of modes on the stack (basically the maximum number of nested objects/arrays in the JSON text to parse)

      • nextEvent

        public int nextEvent()
        Call this method to proceed parsing the JSON text and to get the next event. The method returns JsonEvent.NEED_MORE_INPUT if it needs more input data from the parser's feeder.
        Returns:
        the next JSON event or JsonEvent.NEED_MORE_INPUT if more input is needed

      • getFeeder

        public JsonFeeder getFeeder()
        Get the feeder that can be used to provide more input to the parser
        Returns:
        the parser's feeder

      • getCurrentString

        public java.lang.String getCurrentString()
        If the event returned by nextEvent() was JsonEvent.VALUE_STRING this method will return the parsed string
        Returns:
        the parsed string

      • getCurrentInt

        public int getCurrentInt()
        If the event returned by nextEvent() was JsonEvent.VALUE_INT this method will return the parsed integer
        Returns:
        the parsed integer

      • getCurrentDouble

        public double getCurrentDouble()
        If the event returned by nextEvent() was JsonEvent.VALUE_DOUBLE this method will return the parsed double
        Returns:
        the parsed double
